subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy on Darkness Radio- links for download
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-1190535880-1249351733=:70791
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I think you all did a great job and the samples you used were good examples=
 whether ya said what they were or not. Radio hosts tend to want their show=
 to run their way and for their guests to follow their planned itinerary. I=
f people dont like that go start your own show, do it your own way. It wasn=
t a science experiment it was a talk show. With any evp method it comes dow=
n to one simple idea, that is to try it yourself and get your own results a=
nd prove it or disprove it for ones own self.=A0Everyone may not agree with=
 what you hear but its not an ego contest (for most) for who can get the be=
st evp its about learning theres more out there than what is visible to the=
 naked eye and sharing your experience with others so that they too can try=
 it for themselves. There are many methods and tools for communication and =
anyone who wishes to learn more can do so on their own. 
=A0
Like Debbie sa=
id you either believe it or you dont. You either want to try for yourself o=
r you dont. It isnt up to us to prove or disprove the validity of it, it's =
up to you the individual to come to your own conclusions for your own tests=
 and your own experiements.=A0There are people who=A0run around all day yel=
ling I saw a UFO but until you see one for yourself you=A0may just think th=
ey are nutcases. Even=A0if you see one you still may not believe it. That i=
s your decision to make. We cant make it for you.
=A0
Misty

--- On Mon, 8/=
3/09, psi_research <vilhellm@...> wrote:


From: psi_research <vi=
lhellm@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy=
 on Darkness Radio- links for download
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Mo=
nday, August 3, 2009, 5:22 PM


=A0 



Hey thanks to Steve Hultay and the =
rest of the team for providing many of the files. In response to Rick, it w=
as the desire of Frank and myself to play the audio samples WITHOUT providi=
ng the name of the file to allow the listener to make up their own mind. In=
 fact, I specifically made a written request to the radio show which was co=
pied to Frank on this and the reasons why. Their response was this wasn't a=
 blind evaluation of communication but rather a radio show meant to introdu=
ce Frank and his pioneering work in a personal way to the audience and allo=
w listeners to hear swept tuned device files. It wasn't the proper forum fo=
r an indepth study, it was meant to be a virtual meet and greet between Fra=
nk and the Darkness Radio listeners. -Bill Murphy

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com, "Rick" <rasterer@.. .> wrote:
>
> Unfortunately, the examples used=
 were problematic.
> 
> You might notice they either played the EVP, then t=
old the audience what the they were supposed to hear, and then played it ag=
ain. Or told the audience what they were supposed to hear first. They never=
 just played the sound (without the leading questions), and gave the audien=
ce some time to decide what it was saying on their own.
> 
> So while the h=
istory at the start was interesting, all the examples were, sadly, more exa=
mples of how people can fool themselves with pareidolia, than examples of s=
pirit communications.
> 
> 
> Note also, this also explains why prerecordin=
g noises, and using them later for the source of a Q/A session, still works=
. It's a tricky explanation when trying to explain how spirits are 'changin=
g' the sounds at session time. But it is an easy explanation that it wouldn=
't matter whether the sounds were live or recorded, if it was just people h=
earing what they wanted to hear.
> 
> I realize that many people aren't out=
 to prove anything, and that's fine: but in this case, it seemed a point of=
 the interview was to demonstrate the efficacy of the box. In this case it =
would be better to either state they do not expect their examples to be pro=
ve anything, or if they expect to convince an audience, to use better testi=
ng of their results, and less leading of the audience.
> 
> imho
> 
> 
> 
>=
 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ > wrote:

=

this subject. Great job everyone!
